Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in the heart of Charlottenburg”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter1982
Reviews.Content: Just returned for a four day break in Berlin staying in the Sir F.K Savigny hotel. Location of the hotel is excellent, with a S-ban station literally around the corner. The area which the hotel is located is surrounded by plenty of bars and restaurants which resulted in us never having to travel into the centre at night. The choice for breakfast outside the hotel is also very good, with a special mention for the Schwarzes Cafe a block away on Kantstrasse. The hotel itself has gone for a very modern feel as previous reviewers have commented. With such a design there is a risk that the hotel could look a bit tacky and cheap. However in my opinion it has been decorated very well, especially the lobby/bar area as you enter the hotel. We went for a superior room when we booked which gave us a slightly larger room and a view over the courtyard. The bathroom we had was a separate room and very spacious inside. The bedroom itself was of the small to medium size with a comfortable bed. Free minibar in the room was a nice touch which offered a good selection of soft drinks. My only negative point would be that our items were not replenished during our stay. Although it is understandable with the minibar, it also extended to the coffee and the bathroom items. However, overall it is a lovely hotel in a great location of the city which we would consider staying in again when we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: billmayhols
Reviews.Content: An ultra modern hotel with with all a group of six weekenders needed. It is centrally positioned making it within easy walking distance of Kurfurstendam and all it,s delights. With such a modern black and white decor it can be deemed cold but the friendly staff more than make up for this. Drawbacks would be small rooms and a wasted bar area that does not welcome you, even on a cold January weekend. Good tourist base but not a hotel to spend evening times in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and style!”
Reviews.Author: Dieter H
Reviews.Content: I wonder whether the previous reviewer (10 March) stayed at the same hotel. The location would be hard to beat in Berlin. There are literally dozens of excellent cafes and restaurants within a 200m radius and the area has a wonderful upmarket neighbourhood feel. The hotel is very well connected with the rest of Berlin and within easy walking distance of two opera houses. The rooms are very well sound-proofed compared to other, more expensive, hotels I have stayed in. We spent three nights here and slept well every night. We did not speak to the staff very often, but when we did, everyone was friendly and helpful. We also checked in two hours early without any problem. Our room was not the largest, but it was very elegantly designed and had quality fittings. The screening off of the shower/toilet with frosted glass could be a little problematic, if you shared with a person with whom you were not very familiar. Other than this, we could find absolutely no fault with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Yes but read between the sheets...”
Reviews.Author: dibbyfromtheblock
Reviews.Content: YES this hotel is very centrally located in Charlottenburg and YES it's been highly rated on the internet. YES, if you arrive from a long trip in the morning, the strict rule for check in is 2:30pm and no earlier, so YES you'll have to wait several hours. YES you will have to find your own local cafe for breakfast because only streets are recommended, not specific cafes by the staff (I recommend Sachs Cafe and Cafe Savigny. For dinner, a Portuguese Restaurant called Amelia came very highly rated, as is Ottenthal for GREAT food (best schnitzel in Berlin!) and Florian too).YES, there is free wifi and YES the internet bounces you off CONTINUALLY if you try to surf the net and change pages. YES, the bathroom is IN the bedroom. YES the rooms are incredibly small. YES the service is questionable with attitude from most employees. YES you may be checked in by someone whose English AND German is poor. And YES if you are staying a short time, it's probably worth it. But beware, the sound proofing in the rooms is non-existent, so YES if there are party people in the hotel (there were several) you can hear everything in the corridors until the wee hours in the rooms above, below and next door. WIth all that it is still a great location and trendy rooms, but only if you like SMALL, LOUD and sometimes snotty staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best time in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Stefand22
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights recently, had the best time ever in Berlin. Very modern and comfortabele rooms, very good beds and pillows! Rooms are a bit small but on the other hand they got everything you need. Very nice hotelbar and lobby, great showers as well overall a great hotel to stay when visiting Berlin. You will see me next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Martin32_12
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal on this hotel; if I was paying full price it may have got a lower rating. We had to move rooms as the shower in our first room flooded. The move was quick and hassle free and the staff moved our luggage etc. while we were out, which was good. Beds were comfortable, showers good, TV channel choice good and nice to have a minibar in the room (though only stocked with non-alcoholic drinks). Would have been nice if nespresso pods had been automatically filled up. Free wifi is a bonus. Agree with other reviewers about the customer service - "reception" seemed to be rarely staffed and there seemed to be a very clear hierarchy of staff with those at the top unenthusiastic about working. Those staff who did help were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cold room and cold shoulder at Sir F.K.”
Reviews.Author: Packed-light
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service, horrible hotel management! Booked a 3 night stay in December and only survived one night. Don’t let the well maintained lobby fool you. This place was a hole in the wall. The room floor had a very noticeable odor in the hallway and in the room. The heater in our room stopped working shortly after arrival. We attempted to contact guest services, but did not reach anyone. We headed to lobby to try to find someone, at which point we were notified by the bartender that the hotel does not staff an attendant or maintenance at night. He attempted to contact the hotel manager (who could not be reached of course), as he did not know what to do and was about to get off work. Needless to say we froze in a room with no heat on a winter night Germany. Next day tried to talk with the hotel manager about our issue and was told by him; he does not work 24 hrs a day, and what did we what him to do about it? I asked for a partial refund for that nights stay and even after failing to successfully fix the heater himself, he was not willing to discount or refund our prepaid stay. After, several hours of bickering with the manager we finally checked out of the hotel and into another establishment. We were treated very poorly and will never return to this hotel. Do your self a favor and book somewhere else as the low rate is not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort+Design”
Reviews.Author: brasoygard
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin for sylvester celebration and found an OK deal at Sir F.K. Savigny; a small and cozy boutique hotel situated a 10 minutes walk from the Zoo S-bahn stop. Great location near Kurfürstendamm shopping street. Small rooms, but yet with space enough for two persons. Radio with iPhone docking and a Nespresso machine was included in the rooms. Minibar with free beer, soda and water. Cozy reseption area with a small restaurant in it. Great sleeping comfort.

Reviews.Title: “NEW YEAR VISIT”
Reviews.Author: billmo21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over the new year.it was a pleasant enough hotel and the room was average with little storage so it was out of the suitcase and back in when finished with. Did not see much of the staff as we were out most of the day but the ones we did come across were pleasant enough.We also ate out for breakfast as it was rather expensive and the cafes round about offered a better option.It is a nice area with buses and trains to take you to all the sites and good eating and drinking places so overall we enjoyed our new year sojourn

Reviews.Title: “If its 'Chic' to sleep in your bathroom...”
Reviews.Author: vgs34
Reviews.Content: Based on the majority of the reviews on this hotel, I was eagerly anticipating my stay, and after a tiring journey just after Christmas, sadly I thought it was a real let down. The room we stayed in (which was not the cheapest) was small and had only a small amount of wardrobe space (but not a typical wardrobe) and so our luggage was all over our room, making it hard to move around. The really annoying thing is they fail to mention that your bathroom is basically in your room (or your room is your bathroom?) whereby its expected that you pull accross a white curtain when washing yourself. I am not sure of the purpose of the curtain as directly opposite is a massive mirror, so who ever you are with will see you! The toilet had only frosted glass. The shower is really powerful though, bonus! Another thing to consider - we stayed between the 27-30th December 2011 and at night the room was UNBEARABLY hot. I couldn't figure it out (this was even with the air con), so make sure you pack an industrial fan. This is not a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked, even though we haid PREPAID the room”
Reviews.Author: hkokkone
Reviews.Content: My wife had done a lot of work finding us a great hotel for our two night stay in Berlin. We got to the hotel and were really excited, the hotel looked just as great as it does in the photos. The excitement did not last that long. The receptionist barely said hello to us when we said that we would like to check in. She tapped the computer and then said that we have a problem - the hotel is overbooked! We were stunned because we had made a prepayment (the hotel required it) via Hotels.com. There were no apology for the situation. We arrived to the hotel in the morning, which just means that they had systematically overbooked the hotel. The receptionist then said that they have a sister hotel (hotel excelsior) nearby, which according to her was similar to Sir F.K. Savigny. With no options left they ordered a taxi to take us to Excelsior. When we arrived to Excelsior that this hotel really wasn't similar to Sir F.K. Savigny...it had over 300 rooms compared to 45 rooms at Sir F.K. So now we got a large chain hotel instead of a boutique designer hotel...we were not happy. The receptionist gave us the first room which was supposed the same kind of room that we had at Sir F.K....the room was small, had stains on the wall, etc. We returned to the reception and said that we want to speak again with the hotel manager at Sir F.K. We got hold of the manager and this time he was apologizing for the situation at Sir F.K. But the said that there were simply no rooms left – then he continued that he will make our stay special at Excelsior, he will make sure of that. So after complaining about the first room, we got the supposedly the best room available at Excelsior. It was a regular room on our standards and really not that stylish as the ones in Sir F.K. We were too tired to argue against them anymore and we took the room. Excelsior said that breakfast would be free of charge and that we would get a some sort of gift/fruit basket as an apology from Sir F.K. At the end of the day, we never got any kind of formal apology from Sir F.K., no fruit basket, no nothing (even though we reminded the staff twice!!). We also complained about the broken TV at our room the first night we were there…they said that the technician would fix it the next day…nobody did not do a thing about it! All in all, we were really unsatisfied of the way were treated. So be aware when booking a room from Sir F.K. Savigny. We also cannot recommend Excelsior hotel…the hotel is a standard hotel with a terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: lucy_denham_135
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely sleek, luxurious and stylish, and is in a very good location. The S-bahn trains are easy to use; get off at Savignyplatz station and the hotel is just around the corner. Charlottenburg, Spandau, KaDeWe, Alexanderplatz and the Olympic Stadium are all easy to reach on the S-bahn too. For a good day out we would recommend Friedrishstrasse, a few stops away on the S-bahn, with lots of bars, Irish pubs and lovely restaurants. The bedrooms are small but perfectly formed, however there is not much storage, so probably not good for a long stay. We didn't try the food because it was so expensive, but there are lots of very good restaurants in the area such as Apostel 12 (right by the Savignyplatz station) and some good pubs and bars too. The hotel is quiet, very clean, super modern, with very friendly helpful staff, and (when we were there) no children. There is also free WiFi, and a nice lounge area downstairs for guests. Absolutely perfect for a couple, but wouldn't recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel on a great spot”
Reviews.Author: fluffytiger1
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel in the city centre of Berlin. The S-Bahn is on the corner and lots of restaurants are nearby. We loved the Repke restaurant in the Bleibtreustrasse but also Der Kuchenladen on the Kantstrasse wich serves great cakes. The hotel has a unique design with lots of fotos everywhere. Rooms are spacious and service is really personal. We loved the Nespresso coffeemachine in our room and the nice compfy chair. We did not use the breakfast in the hotel wich was quit expensive (but looked good); lots of coffeshops and bakeries around the corner. We would really go here the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Zoidberg_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. It's an excellently located hotel, with modern, stylish rooms. The only criticism we could make was that the lighting for the bathroom mirror was not particularly good, but this shouldn't detract from the fact that, given its location in a great city, the hotel is really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Supeer hotel & city!”
Reviews.Author: ArturKulaev
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very good, clean and stylish. Located near Ku'damm (like Chans de lise in paris). Near subway station and bus stops. But far away from the main attractions. (10-15 minutes by bus to the The Brandenburg Gate). The worst thing is small room. Really small. Bed and one chair, and nothing else. Bathroom is good, bed is enough for two people. TV is big LCD, plus we have radio with ipod slot. Good hotel, i will advice it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Super in so many ways”
Reviews.Author: CS2752
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days on a business trip and found it super and lovely in so many ways: the interior is chic and relaxed with very friendly personnel and a delicious breakfast; when the wifi signal in my tiny (one-person) room was not strong enough for my work needs, the staff kindly moved me--and to a larger room; the beds were fantastic and I slept very well; and the amenities and small touches throughout were really great--nespresso in the room; nice products in the bathroom. There was one problem with my stay: the hotel had rented the lobby and bar out for a party one night and it was *awful*: guests had no advance warning and to were subjected to loud music and drunken party-goers downstairs until after 1 AM. I was on the second floor (3rd American style) and could hear every beat! A note in the room, with a flower or an offer of a drink in advance (Hi, we're having a party and want to apologize in advance for any inconvenience) would have made *all* the difference. I was surprised. This would normally encourage me to review it much lower than I have, but otherwise the stay was super, so I can only hope the Sir works this out for future guests!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sir F.K. Savigny, great look, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Christophe C
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with relaxed atmosphere, very kind and helpfull personnel with a lot of aid from the hotel manager Martin to organize our future Lions trip in April. We visited more hotels to organize our trip and this one was far out the best combination price/Quality with as a surplus very friendly personnel. See you there in April!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, good price, good location”
Reviews.Author: CahillCricket
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a week and thought it was a fantastic location. It is just around the corner from the subway. The hotel staff is very helpful and was able to recommend delicious but affordable food nearby. The hotel is very chic without being over the top. The breakfast is a bit expensive but the menu choices were quite tasty. The bar serves great cocktails and snacks. I would definitely stay here when I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “3 Night Babymoon in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: AngryPauly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights in this lovely Hotel. We had a great time, the staff were more than helpful and it was nice that it was the same faces everyday. The Hotel had a nice relaxed atmosphere, it was pleasant to sit in the lounge (or courtyard) and have a nice relaxing drink. Breakfast is €15 for as much as you can eat, a good selection of food. Great for transport links, very close S-Bahn and bus routes. Hotel was also close to good restaurants and bars. A small supermarket is also opposite and a bank nearby. We would definitely stay again when we hopefully return in the future! Thank you for a comfortable weekend!

Reviews.Title: “probably the best you can get in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MAC1776
Reviews.Content: The location is probably the best you can get in Berlin. Around the corner to nice restaurants and a S-Bahn station with excellent connections everywhere and still within short walking distance to the main shopping street Kurfürstendamm. My wife and I had a very nice and quiet room, even though it faced the mainstreet we heard no traffic and we will definitly be booking this Hotel again in the Future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Ina Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sitzi
Reviews.Content: This Hotel made our 4 Day stay in Berlin an Even greater pleasure! its a modern Designed Boutique Hotel with friendly service, very nice rooms, and a very good breakfast. The Location couldnt be better very Close to the S and U Bahn so you get everywhere easy and quickly. But at the same time in a very nice and Green neighbourhood where its easy to go out dining at Night Or for a Coffee Or Shopping Or.... I liked the additional fact thaft the wifi is free!

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay at the Sir Savigny!”
Reviews.Author: clairebell27
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed for a weekend in August at the Sir Savigny and absolutely loved it! From the moment we walked in, we received such a friendly and warm welcome from the team, and in particular Martin (who also helped us plan our tour around the city). We had a fantastic room, which was so modern, spacious, clean and airy (the only thing we noted is that there was no soap in the bathroom- which is a VERY minor detail!). The mini bar and free internet access was a great added bonus too! The hotel is located right by the SavignyPlatz (a great place for dinner/drinks - we particularly liked the Spanish and Thai places) and a quick walk to the Ku'damm for shopping and sightseeing. Breakfast was served in the bar/dining area and there was a great selection, and you can even choose to dine in the garden which is a great added bonus. Loved the quirky touches at the hotel- from the red carpet when you walk in, to the cow shaped milk jug at breakfast. It's a great hotel in a perfect location, close to all the sights and we thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A small dimond in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ole A
Reviews.Content: The Sir F.K. Savigny Berlin blew us away with it's stylisness. This is a small reasently referbrished hotel. Very mordern, with photographic themes. The hotel has its foothold at Savigny Platz which in itself is good with the nice surroundings and a lot of good restaurants an bar. Relaxed atmosphere all around. Convinient with the S-Bahn just around the corner. The hotel also have a nice back yard where you can enjoy refreshments from the bar when the weather alows it. Highly recommended, and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “great looks no substance”
Reviews.Author: Birgit L
Reviews.Content: The look of the hotel is great however the service doesn't meet 4* expectations. The hotel room was tiny, no wardrobe and the free minibar is not being stocked up once you had your 3 complimentary drinks from it - regardless of how many nights you stay. The staff is friendly, but again it's missing the quality you would expect for the money you pay. Shower gel is not being stocked up, 'do not disturbe' signs ignored. It's very clean though and the location is great for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff, wonderful location and great room”
Reviews.Author: herman w
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in the S.K Savigny. The manager and the staff were great, with a very helpful welcome and heartwarming friendly service (even flowers were brought to the room at my wife's birthday.) We had a clean, pretty room with a terrace on the top floor. Remarkable boutique interior and nice lobby and bar for a glass of wine in the evening. Location could not be better for me, next to S Bahn and Savigny Platz. And last but not least, very affordable. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this modern Berlin hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nikfromto
Reviews.Content: From the ultra modern lobby to the great hotel rooms we have enjoyed our experience at this hotel. The staff are all friendly. They've gone above and beyond to make us feel welcome. They have given great directions and suggestions of places to go and see. The hotel is located by a s-bahn station and there are lots of places to eat around hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel. Also for kids.”
Reviews.Author: Hanckos
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Fantastic location very close to S-bahn and a fantastic playground for kids just besides the Savigny square. We will come back. No doubt. A supernice and very weel-priced hotel. We would actually say a cheap deal for a totally new four-star hotel. NB! Do have breakfast at the hotel. Really good and a real possibility to have a nice healthy breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Individual stylish place, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Africa_Travels
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel on a business trip to Berlin as I liked the location close to the Savigny Platz with all the restaurants and the Kuhdamm. The place is reasonably new and very neatly done. No real reception desk, just a simple PC on a wooden block. Kept in black and white as well as wood the place has a very distinct flair. My room was a little small but comfortable. Shortly after checking in the lady from the front called and asked if I wanted a bigger room that had just become available. I stayed in the small one as it was fine for me. Comfy bed, rain shower head, good TV and some free soft drinks in the room. There is a small courtyard with some grass and chairs which is pretty relaxing. So the place itself is pretty neat, but what really makes it is the staff. Every single staff I encountered was super friendly and helpful and not the over top type friendly. Just plain friendly and helpful. Need phone charger; no problem, shirt ironed quickly; pleasure, some breakfast at 2pm; sure. Not that I wanted it, but lack of parking and spa make this a very good and not an excellent.

Reviews.Title: “urban, stylish, individual”
Reviews.Author: janmartinK
Reviews.Content: Lots of hotels try to be cool nowadays but this one succeeds effortlessly in its own way. The hotel occupies a narrow building which has been converted with ingenuity and lots of style. Black and white is the signature theme with a set of black-and white photographs being repeated in various places as picture, carpet, elevator ceiling, wallpaper etc. Each room appears to be different (o.k. i've only seen one but one can guess from the layout). My room was a bit small (like most of the other spaces) but very comfortable. In the breakfast room you sit like in a café, with a view of passing people on the street. There's also a little garden in the back. The staff were unobtrusively helpful and friendly, they seemed just the right people for this hotel. I loved it here and I can recommend it to anyone looking for a truly unique and metropolitan place to stay. If lots of space and a quiet neighborhood is what you are looking for you might have to go somewhere else, which would be a pity. I hope to be back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely designer room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Soozysooze
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks amazing. All black and white, great lounge area with ample seats, and a nice bar. Drinks are expensive but then you are in West Berlin. The room (standard business) was small but perfectly formed, with a comfortable bed, flat screen tv, little desk, mini bar and coffee and tea facilities. The toilet and shower room are separate, a luxury in Berlin, and practically next to the bed. They are hidden behind opaque glass... you can't see through them but it does feel a bit odd, sitting on a loo that is so near the bed. It all looks pretty and boutiquey though. There is curtain you can close next to the bed, to give a bit more of an idea of separation between bathroom area and sleep area. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel. We had a drink, and asked the bar man for advice on restaurants in the area. He was thorough in his reply, and indeed there are many nice places nearby to choose from. We followed the man's advice and went to nearby Dao restaurant (Thai food) which was very good. There was some noise from the corridor filtering into the room during the night, slamming doors mainly. I think it was more due to our fellow hotel guests than the hotel, though you might conclude that the sound insulation from corridor to room is not the highest quality. It didn't bother me too much. On leaving, we were able to leave our luggage in the luggage room, as you would expect, and when collecting they helped to carry it to the door and offered to call a taxi. Lovely service and a great atmosphere at Sir Savigny!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a reservation for any rooms in Berlin and we got there at 4 a.m. We were walking around looking for a decent priced hotel when we found Hotel Crystal. It's on Kantstrasse, very near the Savignyplatz Bahn station. Anyway, we got a great deal, great room and the staff was really friendly and helpful. If you're looking for high end hotels, then maybe this hotel is not for you. But if you don't mind staying some place very antique-ish, then this is for you. Our room didn't have a tv, but there's one at the lounge downstairs. It is quite near great places to eat and easy to commute from the hotel too. Great experience, and we are even planning to stay there next time we are in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Expatriots forging common bonds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I quite literally stumbled upon the Hotel Crystal on arrival in Berlin. The Hotel is centrally located, in Savigny Platz about a 10 minute walk from the "Ku-Dam" and 5 minutes from the S-Bahn. We had a room on the top floor with balcony facing the tree-lined street. Very quiet, unassuming and "gemütlich". We felt very much at home with our British concierge, Scottish bar friends, and other traveling Americans. If you like a bit of the old world (think Cold War spy movies), you'll love the ambience here. Book well in advance!

HotelInfo.Name: Sir F.K. Savigny Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Kantstrasse 144, 10623 Berlin, Germany
